pages.text: When facing an enemy you are hunting, it is best to be prepared with the $(l:weapon_category)correct weapon$() to hunt them with. Enemies are classified into two categories: $(l:contracts/enemy_types#page_monsters)Monsters$(), and $(l:contracts/enemy_types#page_non_humans)Non-Humans$(). Dealing damage with the correct blade type while holding $(l:signs_abilities/blade_oil#page_blade_oil)[Blade Oil]$() will deal additional damage to these foes.

pages.name: Monsters
pages.text: Monsters are the largest category of contracted foe, and require a $(l:weapons_armour/silver_sword_entry#page_silver_sword)silver sword$() and their respective $(l:contracts/contracts#page_contracts)contract$() to harvest their $(l:contracts/trophies#page_trophies)trophy.$()

pages.title: Monsters, Continued:
pages.text: $(li)Silverfish$(li)Slime$(li)Wither Skeleton$(li)Zoglin$(li)Zombie Villager$(li)Elder Guardian$(li)Ravager$(li)Shulker$(li)Skeleton Horse$(li)Vex$(li)Warden$(li)Ender Dragon$(li)Wither$(li)Allay$(li)Snow Golem$(li)Iron Golem$(li)Glow Squid
Not all "monster" entities have contracts associated with them!

pages.name: Non-Humans
pages.text: Non-Humans have less contracts associated with them, but still require a $(l:weapons_armour/steel_sword_entry#page_steel_sword)steel sword$() and their respective $(l:contracts/contracts#page_contracts)contract$() to harvest their $(l:contracts/trophies#page_trophies)trophy.$()
Not all "non-human" entities have contracts associated with them!
